com.compendium.core.db.management
Class DBNewDatabase

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.management.DBNewDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBProgressListener
public class DBNewDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBProgressListener

This class handles creating a new database, adds the default data to it and if required, a new user record. It allows external classes to register DBProgressListeners and fires appropriate progress information to them. This facilitates the display of progress information in a user interface, if desired.

Author:
Michelle Bachler

Constructor Detail

DBNewDatabase

public DBNewDatabase(int nDatabaseType,
                     DBAdminDatabase admin,
                     java.lang.String sDatabaseUserName,
                     java.lang.String sDatabasePassword,
                     java.lang.String sDatabaseIP)
This constructor takes a name and password to use when accessing the database, and the IP address of the server machine.

Parameters:
nDatabaseType, - the type of the database being used (e.g, MySQL, Derby).
DBAdminDatabase - admin, a reference to the administration database so that the new database can be registered.
sDatabaseUserName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the database
sDatabaseIP, - the IP address of the server machine. The default if 'localhost'.

DBNewDatabase

public DBNewDatabase(int nDatabaseType,
                     DBAdminDatabase admin,
                     UserProfile up,
                     boolean isDefaultUser,
                     java.lang.String sDatabaseUserName,
                     java.lang.String sDatabasePassword,
                     java.lang.String sDatabaseIP)
Constructor, takes the user profile to add to the newly created database. This constructor takes a name and password to use when accessing the database, and the IP address of the server machine.

Parameters:
nDatabaseType, - the type of the database being used (e.g, MySQL, Derby).
DBAdminDatabase - admin, a reference to the administration database so that the nwe database can be registered.
UserProile - up, the UserProfile of a new user to be added to the newly created database.
sDatabaseUserName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the database
sDatabaseIP, - the IP address of the server machine. The default if 'localhost'.
Method Detail

createNewDatabase

public void createNewDatabase(java.lang.String sFriendlyName)
                       throws DBDatabaseNameException,
                              DBDatabaseTypeException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                              java.io.IOException,
                              java.sql.SQLException,
                              java.io.FileNotFoundException
Create a new database, and then load the default data. If a user was specified in the constructor, add the new user details to the new database.

Parameters:
String - sFriendlyName, the name of the database as seen by a Compendium user. This name is 'cleaned' to remove illegal characters and a time/date stamp is addded.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.io.IOException
java.io.FileNotFoundLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
DBDatabaseNameException
DBDatabaseTypeException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
See Also:
CoreUtilities.cleanDatabaseName(java.lang.String)

private void insertNewUser(java.sql.Connection con)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
If new user details where passed into the contructor, set up the new user and their home page.

Parameters:
Connection - con, the connection to use to write the new user information to the database.
